questions.question: What is the intellectual awakening in contemporary Indian society called?
Who established the Brahmo Samaj in Bengal in 1828?
Which newspaper was started by Raja Rammohan Roy to create public awareness?
The Paramhansa Sabha was established in Mumbai in 1848 by ________.
Who founded the Prarthana Samaj?
Which organization gave the slogan 'Back to the Vedas'?
Who wrote the book 'Satyarth Prakash'?
Who founded the Satyashodhak Samaj in 1873?
What was the main principle of the Satyashodhak Samaj?
The Aligarh Movement was led by ________.
Who established the Ramkrishna Mission in 1897?
At which place did Swami Vivekananda give his famous speech on Hinduism in 1893?
Which of these message was given by Swami Vivekananda to the youth?

options.text: Arise, Awake and stop not till the goal is achieved

questions.answer: Arise, Awake and stop not till the goal is achieved

questions.question: In which state did the Sikh community start the Singh Sabha movement?
Who started the first school for girls at Bhide Wada, Pune in 1848?
Which social reformer opened his own water reservoir for untouchables?
Who was the first female teacher in India?
questions.answer: Savitribai Phule was the first female teacher in India.

questions.question: Who started the 'Balhatya Pratibandhak Gruha' in his own house?
Gopal Hari Deshmukh is popularly known as ________.
Who wrote 'Shatapatre' to create social awareness through the weekly Prabhakar?
Whose efforts led to the passing of the Widow Remarriage Act in 1856?
The 'Vidhava Vivahottejak Mandali' was established by ________.
Who founded the 'Anath Balikashram' in 1907?
The first Women's University in India was established by ________.
Who established the 'Sharada Sadan' to help destitute women?
The 'Seva Sadan' institution was founded by ________.
Who wrote the book 'Stri-Purush Tulana'?
Who was the first Indian lady doctor?
Who started the 'Depressed Classes Mission' for the progress of Dalits in 1906?
Rajarshi Shahu Maharaj worked for the abolition of caste distinction in the state of ________.
Who led the movement for social equality for Dalits using the principle of 'self-respect'?
The 'Bahishkrut Hitkarini Sabha' was established by ________.
Who started the Satyagraha at Chavdar lake in Mahad?
Which social reformer was known as the pioneer of Indian Renaissance?
The principles of Humanity, Equality, and ________ were central to the Renaissance.
Which reformer studied multiple languages and religions to develop his ideology of Advaita philosophy?
The Satyashodhak Samaj was specifically founded for the progress of which groups?
The 'Anglo-Mohammedan Oriental College' later became known as ________.
Who was the founder of the Brahmo Samaj?
Which reformer fought against the Sati practice through persistent efforts?
Who established the Hindu College in Kolkata?
Who was the pioneer of the social reform movement in India?
The 'Paramhansa Sabha' principles included ________.
What was the motto of Satyashodhak Samaj?

options.text: Monotheism and universal brotherhood without middleman

questions.answer: Monotheism and universal brotherhood without middleman

questions.question: Swami Dayanand Saraswati founded the Arya Samaj in ________.
The main objective of Ramkrishna Mission was ________.
Which magazine/newspaper was associated with Maharshi Karve?
Who founded the Brahmo Samaj?
Rajarshi Shahu Maharaj gave reservation in the state of Kolhapur in ________.
Who wrote 'Gulamgiri' to protest against the class and caste inequality?
What is the term used for the intellectual awakening in Indian society during the 19th century?
Who established the Brahmo Samaj and in which year?
questions.answer: Raja Rammohan Roy established the Brahmo Samaj in 1828.

questions.question: What were the main principles of the Brahmo Samaj?
questions.answer: Monotheism, caste and class equality, protest against rituals, and following the way of prayers.

questions.question: Name the newspaper started by Raja Rammohan Roy to create public awareness.
Which social evils did Raja Rammohan Roy oppose?
questions.answer: Sati practice, child marriage, and the Purdah system.

questions.question: What did Raja Rammohan Roy promote for women?
Which college did Raja Rammohan Roy found in Kolkata?
Who established the Paramhansa Sabha in Mumbai and in which year?
questions.answer: Dadoba Pandurang Tarkhadkar established it in 1848.

questions.question: What was the name of the organization formed after the dissolution of Paramhansa Sabha?
Who was the first President of the Prarthana Samaj?
Name two prominent leaders who carried forward the work of Prarthana Samaj.
questions.answer: Justice Ranade and Dr. R. G. Bhandarkar.

questions.question: What were the principles of Prarthana Samaj?
questions.answer: Opposition to idol worship, monotheism, opposition to rituals, and stress on devotion and prayers.

questions.question: Name one social service activity started by Prarthana Samaj.
questions.answer: It started orphanages, women's education institutes, night schools for workers, and a society for Dalits.

questions.question: Who established the 'Depressed Classes Mission' and which organization was he a member of?
questions.answer: Maharshi Vithal Ramji Shinde, a member of Prarthana Samaj, established it.

questions.question: Who founded the Satyashodhak Samaj and in which year?
questions.answer: Mahatma Jyotirao Phule founded it in 1873.

questions.question: What was the core principle of the Satyashodhak Samaj?
questions.answer: Formation of society on the basis of equality.

questions.question: What social issues did Mahatma Jyotirao Phule protest against?
questions.answer: Untouchability and discrimination based on gender.

questions.question: Name two books written by Mahatma Jyotirao Phule.
Who founded the Arya Samaj and in which year?
questions.answer: Swami Dayanand Saraswati founded it in 1875.

questions.question: What was the slogan of the Arya Samaj?
Name the book written by Swami Dayanand Saraswati as a commentary on the Vedas.
What did the Arya Samaj believe about caste and gender according to Vedic religion?
questions.answer: It believed the ancient Vedic religion had no place for casteism and existed with gender equality.

questions.question: Who established the Ramkrishna Mission and in which year?
What was the main objective of the Ramkrishna Mission?
questions.answer: Service to society, including help during famine, medical aid, female education, and spiritual growth.

questions.question: Where did Swami Vivekananda attend the Parliament of Religions as a representative of Hinduism?
What message did Swami Vivekananda give to Indian youth?
questions.answer: 'Arise, Awake and stop not till the goal is achieved'.

questions.question: Which organization was established for reforms in the Sikh religion?
questions.answer: The Singh Sabha, established at Amritsar.

questions.question: What did the Singh Sabha work towards?
questions.answer: Spread of education and modernization among the Sikh community.

questions.question: Which movement continued the Sikh reformation tradition after the Singh Sabha?
What was the condition of women in Indian society during British rule?
questions.answer: Miserable, with no right to education and unequal treatment.

questions.question: Name one social reformer who helped Lord Bentinck pass the Sati Prohibition Act.
What was the pen name of Gopal Hari Deshmukh?
Through which writings did Gopal Hari Deshmukh advocate gender equality?
Where and when did Mahatma Phule start the first school for girls?
questions.answer: At Bhide Wada in Pune in 1848.

questions.question: Who supported Mahatma Phule in starting the girls' school?
What did Mahatma Phule establish in his own house?
questions.answer: 'Bal Hatya Pratibandhak Gruha' (a home to prevent infanticide).

questions.question: Why did Mahatma Phule conduct a strike of barbers?
questions.answer: To protest against the custom of shaving the heads of widows.

questions.question: Name three reformers who worked for widow remarriage.
questions.answer: Pandit Ishwarchandra Vidyasagar, Vishnushastri Pandit, and Vireshalingam Pantulu.

questions.question: In which newspaper did Gopal Ganesh Agarkar express strong opinions on social issues?
Who wrote the book 'Stri Purush Tulana' and what was it about?
questions.answer: Tarabai Shinde wrote it, fiercely expressing views on women's rights.

questions.question: What did Maharshi Dhondo Karve start for girls?
What was Maharshi Dhondo Karve's main intention for women?
questions.answer: To give education to all women and make them self-reliant.

questions.question: What major institution did Maharshi Dhondo Karve help establish in the 20th century?
questions.answer: The first women's university in India.

questions.question: What did Pandita Ramabai found?
questions.answer: Sharada Sadan, for the care of disabled children and women.

questions.question: Through which institute did Ramabai Ranade start a nursing course for women?
What political right did Ramabai Ranade demand for women?
Who spoke about injustice towards women through articles?
What was the impact of the women's reform movement?
questions.answer: It helped close down many unjust practices and allowed women to voice their problems and express their thoughts through writing.

questions.question: Who started social reform among the Muslim community in Bengal?
Which society did Abdul Latif establish?
Who founded the Mohammedan Anglo Oriental College?
What did the Mohammedan Anglo Oriental College later become?
What did Sir Sayyid Ahmad Khan advocate for Muslim progress?
questions.answer: The study of modern education, science, and technology.

questions.question: When was the Hindu Mahasabha established and for what purpose?
questions.answer: In 1915, to give a respectable position to the Hindu community.

questions.question: Who laid the foundation of Banaras Hindu University?
Who established the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) and in which year?
questions.answer: Dr. Keshav Baliram Hedgewar established it in 1925 at Nagpur.

questions.question: What was the aim of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh?
questions.answer: To set up a disciplined and virtuous organization of Hindu youth.

questions.question: What did V.D. Savarkar build at Ratnagiri and what was its significance?
questions.answer: He built the 'Patit Pawan Temple', open to all castes of Hindu religion.

questions.question: What activity did V.D. Savarkar arrange to promote equality?
Name an Indian who won the Nobel Prize in Literature during the Renaissance period.
Name an Indian who won the Nobel Prize in Science during the Renaissance period.
How did stories and novels contribute during the Renaissance period?
questions.answer: They gave inspiration for independence and expressed thoughts on social reforms.

questions.question: What role did newspapers and magazines play during this period?
questions.answer: They became a source of social reform and political awakening.

questions.question: What development occurred in the field of painting during the Renaissance?
questions.answer: Indian style and western techniques were combined, leading to a new school of painting.

questions.question: What did people start realizing was important for the country's progress?
On which principles did Indian social reformers set up a nationwide political movement?
Which governor passed the Sati Prohibition Act with the help of social reformers?
What custom did Maharshi Vithal Ramji Shinde organize a conference against?
What was the main focus of the Arya Samaj's work across India?
What was the occupation of the people for whom Prarthana Samaj started night schools?
In which city was the Singh Sabha established?
What did Swami Vivekananda emphasize as important for service?
questions.answer: Service to society and spiritual growth.

questions.question: Which act is associated with the efforts of Raja Rammohan Roy and Lord Bentinck?
What did the 'Depressed Classes Mission' attempt to do?
questions.answer: Solve the social problems of the depressed classes.

questions.question: What type of equality did the Satyashodhak Samaj advocate?
questions.answer: Social equality, including gender and caste equality.

questions.question: What was the name of the school of painting that emerged during the Renaissance?
questions.answer: A new school combining Indian style and western techniques (often called the Bengal School or modern Indian painting).

questions.question: Which two reformers are associated with the Prarthana Samaj's early leadership?
questions.answer: Justice M.G. Ranade and Dr. R.G. Bhandarkar.

questions.question: What did the 'Bal Hatya Pratibandhak Gruha' aim to prevent?
What was the role of Savitribai Phule in education?
questions.answer: She was a pioneer in women's education, co-founding the first girls' school and facing societal criticism for her work.

questions.question: Which university was founded by Pandit Madan Mohan Malviya?
What was the significance of the 'Patit Pawan Temple'?
questions.answer: It was open to all Hindu castes, promoting caste equality.

questions.question: What did the 'Mohammedan Literary Society' focus on?
questions.answer: Social and literary reform among Muslims in Bengal.

questions.question: What was the main contribution of Gopal Ganesh Agarkar's newspaper 'Sudharak'?
questions.answer: It provided strong opinions on social issues like child marriage and the law of consent.

questions.question: What was the primary method used by social reformers to create awareness?
questions.answer: Writings in newspapers, books, and establishing educational institutions.

questions.question: What did the 'Anath Balikashram' provide?
questions.answer: Shelter and education for orphaned girls.

questions.question: How did the Renaissance movement influence the freedom struggle?
questions.answer: It created a sense of liberty, equality, and nationalism, leading to a nationwide political movement.

questions.question: Which reformer is known for advocating widow remarriage through legal efforts?
What was the impact of English education on Indian society?
questions.answer: It spread new thoughts, ideas, and philosophy, leading to social and religious reforms.

questions.question: What did the 'Seva Sadan Institute' offer to women?
questions.answer: Nursing courses and other vocational training.

questions.question: What was the common goal of all social reform movements?
questions.answer: To eradicate social evils and create a new society based on humanity, equality, and fraternity.

questions.question: Name the reformer who was a close disciple of Ramkrishna Paramhansa.
What did the 'Sharada Sadan' provide for women and children?
questions.answer: Care and shelter for disabled children and women.

questions.question: Which social reformer is associated with the book 'Satyarth Prakash'?
What was the role of women in the freedom movement according to the chapter?
What did the 'Hindu Mahasabha' aim to achieve?
questions.answer: A respectable position for the Hindu community.

questions.question: Which reformer worked for the upliftment of Dalits through the 'Depressed Classes Mission'?
What was the main critique in Mahatma Phule's book 'Gulamgiri'?
questions.answer: It criticized caste-based exploitation and advocated for equality.

questions.question: What was the significance of the 'Parliament of Religions' in Chicago for India?
questions.answer: It was where Swami Vivekananda presented Hinduism to the world, boosting India's pride.

questions.question: How did music develop during the Renaissance period?
questions.answer: It became more popular and saw new developments.

questions.question: What was the underlying belief of Sir Sayyid Ahmad Khan regarding religion and education?
questions.answer: He believed Muslims could progress by embracing modern education without abandoning their faith.
